title: How to View and Change the Margins in Word

steps.title: Open a Word document on your Mac.
steps.content: Open a Word document on your Mac. You can open a saved document from your computer or open Microsoft Word, and create a new document.

steps.title: Click the Word tab on the menu bar.
steps.content: Click the Word tab on the menu bar. You can find this button next to the Apple icon near the upper-left corner of your screen. It will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Preferences.
steps.content: Click Preferences . This will open your Word settings.

steps.title: Click View in Preferences.
steps.content: Click View in Preferences. This is the second option on the top row of the Preferences window. You can find it under the "Authoring and Proofing Tools" heading.

steps.title: Find the Text boundaries option.
steps.content: Find the Text boundaries option. It's near the upper-right corner under the "Show in Document" heading.

steps.title: Click and check the box next to Text boundaries.
steps.content: Click and check the box next to Text boundaries . When this option is checked, you'll see the margin lines around your text in the document.

steps.title: Open a Word document on your computer.
steps.content: Open a Word document on your computer. You can open a saved document or open Microsoft Word, and create a new document.

steps.title: Click the File tab.
steps.content: Click the File tab. You can find this button above the toolbar ribbon in the upper-left corner of Word. It will open your file options. If you're using Word 2007, click the Office icon on the top-left.

steps.title: Click Options on the file menu.
steps.content: Click Options on the file menu. This will open your Word options in a new window. In Word 2007, click Word Options on the bottom-right.

steps.title: Click the Advanced tab in Options.
steps.content: Click the Advanced tab in Options. It's on the left-hand side of the Options window.

steps.title: Find the Show text boundaries option.
steps.content: Find the Show text boundaries option. It's under the "Show document content" heading in the Advanced tab.

steps.title: Click and check the box next to Show text boundaries.
steps.content: Click and check the box next to Show text boundaries . This will show your margin lines around the text in your document.
